bill_title: to allow the referral of certain county actions regarding concentrated animal feeding operations and to establish certain restrictions on such operations.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the referral of certain county actions regarding concentrated animal feeding operations and to establish certain restrictions on such operations. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any county, whether or not the county has adopted zoning ordinances or zoning regulations, or the voters of the county, using the procedures for initiated measures pursuant to § § 7-18A-9 to 7-18A-14, inclusive, may adopt an ordinance to prohibit the establishment in the county of any concentrated animal feeding operation if the operation would include a number of animals equal to or greater than one thousand animal units or may adopt an ordinance to prohibit any expansion of an existing concentrated animal feeding operation that would cause the operation to equal or exceed one thousand animal units. Section 2. Any decision of a board of county commissioners or of a county planning commission or board of adjustment related to the establishment or expansion of a concentrated animal feeding operation in the county, whether the decision is a legislative or administrative decision or action by the county, is referable pursuant to § § 7-18-15 to 7-18A-24, inclusive. Section 3. In any county in which no zoning ordinances or regulations are in force pursuant to chapter 11-2, no concentrated animal feeding operation that would include a number of animals equal to or greater than one thousand animal units may be located within two miles of any residence unless a member of the household is an owner or contractor of the concentrated animal feeding operation, and no such operation may be located within three miles of the boundaries of any municipality or within three miles of any public water supply. No existing concentrated animal feeding operation in any such county may be expanded to equal or exceed one thousand animal units if the operation is located within three miles of the boundaries of a municipality, within three miles of a public water supply, or within two miles of a residence in which no member of the household is an owner or contractor of the concentrated animal feeding operation operation.
